title: KHR_physics_rigid_bodies Node Collider Property
description: Parameters describing a shape used for collison detection and response.

shape.description: The index of the shape in the top level shapes array.

mesh.description: The index of the mesh from which to build the collision representation.

skin.description: The index of a skin with which to deform the mesh.

weights.description: The weights of the instantiated morph target.

useNodeWeights.description: Use weights supplied by a node which references this geometry. When true, a node referencing this object **MUST** have a weights property, the length of which which **MUST** match the number of morph targets of the weights of the mesh referenced by this object.

convexHull.description: Specifies whether the collision geometry is a surface or a convex hull.
convexHull.gltf_detailedDescription: Specifies how the collision shape is generated from the referenced mesh. When this value is false, the collision volume of this shape is the surface of the referenced mesh. When this value is true, this shape represents the convex hull of the set of primitives in the referenced mesh.

physicsMaterial.description: The index of the physics material in the top level physicsMaterials array.

collisionFilter.description: The index of the filter information in the top level collisionFilters array.
